SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=01/green_tripdata_2020-01.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]




--select data from a folder
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=01/**',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]


--select files from sub folders.specify double **
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/**',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]

--Getting data from more than one file

SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ('trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=01/*.csv',
        'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=02/*.csv'),
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]

-- use more than 1 wildercard character: Get data from all the years and all the months csv file
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]


-- Metadata funtions, how to get the file names corresping to the data: use filename () function

SELECT
    TOP 100 
    result.filename() AS file_name,
    result.*
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]

-- Check how many records are on each of the files

SELECT
    result.filename() AS file_name,
    count(1)record_count 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]
    GROUP BY result.filename()
    ORDER BY result.filename();

     -- Check how many records are on each of the files, for specifc file names
    SELECT
    result.filename() AS file_name,
    count(1)record_count 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]
    WHERE result.filename() IN ('green_tripdata_2020-04.csv','green_tripdata_2020-01.csv')
    GROUP BY result.filename()
    ORDER BY result.filename();

-- use filepath function
SELECT
    result.filename() AS file_name,
    result.filepath() AS file_path,
    COUNT(1) AS record_count 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]
    WHERE result.filename() IN ('green_tripdata_2020-04.csv','green_tripdata_2020-01.csv')
    GROUP BY result.filename(), result.filepath()
    ORDER BY result.filename();


-- FIle path parameter, to return position of a wildcard character, eg year, month etc
SELECT
    result.filename() AS file_name,
    result.filepath(1) AS year,
    result.filepath(2) AS month,
    COUNT(1) AS record_count 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]
    WHERE result.filename() IN ('green_tripdata_2020-04.csv','green_tripdata_2020-01.csv')
    GROUP BY result.filename(), result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2)
    ORDER BY result.filename(), result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2);

--This helps to easily get the trip count for year and a month

SELECT
    result.filepath(1) AS year,
    result.filepath(2) AS month,
    COUNT(1) AS record_count 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]
    GROUP BY result.filename(), result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2)
    ORDER BY result.filename(), result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2);

--- you can use filepath function on the WHERE clause
SELECT
    result.filepath(1) AS year,
    result.filepath(2) AS month,
    COUNT(1) AS record_count 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxidata_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]
    WHERE result.filepath(1) ='2020'
    AND result.filepath(2) IN ('06','07','09')
    GROUP BY result.filename(), result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2)
    ORDER BY result.filename(), result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2);
